other_tests.findings: Replacement of hematopoietic cells was not sufficient to prevent ectopic skeletogenesis. Stable engraftment was not established from the first transplant, but a second transplant confirmed stable engraftment with a female karyotype in 100% of the evaluated peripheral blood cells.
other_tests.changes_over_time: While the patient was under immunosuppression, flare-ups of fibrodysplasia ossificans progressiva were notably absent. After cessation of immunosuppression, mild flare-ups slowly returned, with severe flare-ups occurring two years later in previously uninvolved areas.

other_tests.findings: 100% donor cells were identified in all hematopoietic cell lineages twenty-five years following bone marrow transplantation.
The karyotype was normal prior to transplantation and confirmed a female karyotype 100% of the time in peripheral blood cells evaluated after transplantation.
